body:
Comment 1: 
There seem to be two different problems here.

The first is a bad system call from the go_bootstrap program.  You may be able to figure
that out by running strace or truss to see what the system call is.

The second is that gdb gets confused by the debug info for go_bootstrap.  That has
nothing to do with the bad system call.  That may be because you are using an old
version of gdb.  The Go linker will generate that for objects with no type, and most
versions of gdb do not complain.  What version of gdb are you using?
_Labels changed: added **openbsd**._
